pros: Students are prioritized Great people to work with Strong leadership
cons: Rural location and a far drive from large population centers in the area

pros: Close team. Student focused, mission driven.
cons: Remote location, limited convenience resources such as lunch places, coffee places nearby.

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Cleveland, WI
pros: Not sure there are too many-perhaps their disorganization allows one to get away with stuff?!
cons: Recognized cost of living-4.7% College gave 2% to base pay. They don’t care about you as staff.

pros: The retirement fund is through the state which is great
cons: Poor management, which trickles down from the top and everyone blames everyone else

review_title: No communication, knee-jerk reactions to minor things
pros: Team of people I work with and being able to ask questions to other departments.
cons: No communication from management when college wide decisions are made, knee-jerk reactions to minor complaints (Ex. a call went to voicemail) that cause entire departments to cover the brilliant idea to 'fix' the complaint.

review_title: Very political environment with a lot of red tape and hierarchy difficulties.
pros: Enjoyable colleagues at the lower levels. Upper management is overworked with little time to see what's really happening internally.  Too many meetings with nothing produced for the effort.
cons: Many part-time workers with little opportunity available to advance unless you catch upper management's eye.

pros: Flexible schedule options, including telecommutes; onsite childcare for ages 2-6 years; small college campus with excellent location that includes natural areas, creek, renewable energy demos, and free parking; and major investments in employee professional development.
cons: Bedroom community with few other opportunities for spouses and children. Nearby cities have slightly more to offer, including a timely and sometimes expensive commute.
Leadership is stale and misdirecting energy
